newsitem.title: CANADA: Ontario Hydro says not affected by labor protest.
newsitem.headline: Ontario Hydro says not affected by labor protest.

text.p: Ontario Hydro, North America's biggest power utility, said on Wednesday that it will not be affected by a planned labor protest in Canada's largest city later this week.
Labor and social activists are gathering in Toronto for two days of protest against the Ontario Conservative government's fiscal policies.

Pickets are expected to disrupt city transportation services as well as government offices, schools and businesses on Friday and Saturday. But Ontario Hydro said its transmission facilities in the city would not be affected.
"We don't anticipate any effect on the power system. We have some transmission facilities (in Toronto), but we don't expect the protest to affect those," spokesman Al Manchee said.
Provincial government-owned Ontario Hydro has no power generation facilities in the Toronto area, he said.
